programme.title: Changing Times
programme.desc: The Olympic Series Vol.5, Program 3 : The story of Women at the Games, Changing Times.

programme.title: Mat 1: Women's -63kg, Men's -81kg Repechages/Semi-Finals/Finals | Judo | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's -63kg and Men's -81kg Finals took place on 30/07/2024 at the Champ-de-Mars Arena, Paris. At the Women's -63kg, Andreja Leski (SLO) claimed the Gold medal, Prisca Awiti Alcaraz (MEX) won the Silver, and the Bronze medals went to Laura Fazliu (KOS) and Clarisse Agbegnenou (FRA). At the Men's -81kg,Takanori Nagase (JPN) won the Gold medal, Tato Grigalashvili (GEO) took the Silver, and the Bronze medals went to Somon Makhmadbekov (TJK) and Joonhwan Lee (KOR).

programme.title: Men's 4x200m Freestyle Relay - Final | Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's 4x200m Freestyle was held on 30/07/2024 at Paris La Defense Arena. Great Britain claimed the Gold with a time of 6:59.43, The United States of America took Silver and Australia completed the podium.

programme.title: Meet the transgender swim star who’s earned a spot on the men’s team
programme.desc: Schuyler Bailar is a decorated swimmer who was recruited to Harvard as a female, but has found peace after transitioning to a male.

programme.title: Becoming an Olympic Legend | 72 - A Gathering of Champions
programme.desc: Fifty years after his famous tally of seven Olympic gold medals and seven world records, legendary swimmer Mark Spitz makes an emotional return to Munich Olympic Park and the swimming pool, where his life was changed forever.

programme.title: Memory Lane | 72 - A Gathering of Champions
programme.desc: Fifty years after their Olympic victories in Munich, famed gymnast Olga Korbut, Germany’s long jump star Heide Rosendahl, Kenya’s long-distance running hero Kip Keino and Great Britain’s celebrated pentathlete Mary Peters make an emotional return to the scene of their gold medal wins.

programme.title: 4 x 400m Relay Mixed Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The 4x400m Relay Mixed Final took place at Stade de France, on 03/08/24. The Netherlands took Gold with a time of 3:07.43, The United States of America took Silver and Great Britain completed the podium.

programme.title: Women's 100m Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 100m Final took place at Stade de France, on 03/08/24. Julien Alfred (LCA) won Gold with a time of 10.72sec, Sha'carri Richardson (USA) took Silver and Melissa Jefferson (USA) completed the podium.

programme.title: The Distance | Five Rings Films
programme.desc: The story of an enduring Japanese marathon tradition and a humble champion named Naoko Takahashi who captured her nation’s imagination with a run for the ages at the 2000 Olympic Games.

programme.title: Women's High Jump Qualifying B | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's High Jump Qualification B took place on 02/08/2024 at the Stade de France.

programme.title: Memory Lane | 72 - A Gathering of Champions
programme.desc: Fifty years after their Olympic victories in Munich, famed gymnast Olga Korbut, Germany’s long jump star Heide Rosendahl, Kenya’s long-distance running hero Kip Keino and Great Britain’s celebrated pentathlete Mary Peters make an emotional return to the scene of their gold medal wins.

programme.title: Women's High Jump Qualifying A | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's High Jump Qualification A took place on 02/08/2024 at the Stade de France.

programme.title: Arriba Cuba
programme.desc: An exploration of the past, present and future of sports in Cuba at a time of unprecedented change.

programme.title: Long Jump Decathlon Group B | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's Decathlon Group B Long Jump took place on 02/08/2024 at the Stade de France. Sander Skotheim (NOR) led the event with an 8.03m jump.

programme.title: Inspired by Sport (Film)
programme.desc: Olympians visit inspiring community sports organizations to witness the power of sport to transform lives.

programme.title: Long Jump Decathlon Group A | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's Decathlon Group A Long Jump took place on 02/08/2024 at the Stade de France. Ayden Owens-Delerme (PUR) led the event with a 7.66m jump.

programme.title: Heroes of the Future - Giorgia Villa & Demis Angagregn
programme.desc: Giorgia Villa, a 12 year old Italian Artistic Gymnast, and Demis Angagregn, a 16 year old Runner from Ethiopia, compete for their future.

programme.title: Ethiopia’s Derartu Tulu I Legends Live On
programme.desc: A look at the Olympic achievements of the first black African female gold medallist Derartu Tulu, who is now leading Ethiopia’s national athletics team.

programme.title: Day Jobs | Episode 5
programme.desc: Karate world champion Paula Rodriguez earns her living as a firefighter. Japanese’s ice hockey star Ami Nakamura works as a shop assistant.

programme.title: After unspeakable sadness, Skujyte finds redemption in reallocated medal
programme.desc: After years of doubt, doping sanctions saw Lithuanian heptathlete Austra Skujyte upgraded from fifth place in the London 2012 heptathlon to the bronze medal. Watch how she found overdue redemption following her fourth and final Olympic Games.

programme.title: Road to Glory - Athletics - The Sprinters
programme.desc: A journey through the essential stories of the Olympic Games, focusing on the sprints in athletics, including Jesse Owens and Carl Lewis.

programme.title: Running in North Korea | Film
programme.desc: A new Original documentary that captures the incredible journey of Aimee Fuller and Mirjam Jaeger as they travel to Pyongyang to participate in the 2019 Mangyongdae Prize International Marathon and meet fellow Olympians from the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea.
